DOC.brief_summary: This study pilot ass feasibility prenatal intervention obese pregnant woman base Diabetes Prevention Program ( DPP ) . Intervention group participant meet clinic dietitian 15 minute every prenatal appointment complete DPP-based curriculum receive breastfeed education . Control group participant receive usual prenatal care . Outcomes include reach dose intervention , gestational weight gain , dietary intake , physical activity , breastfeed first 6 week postpartum .
DOC.brief_title: Partnership Improve Nutrition Adiposity Prenatal Clinical Care : Pilot Feasibility Study
DOC.detailed_description: This study pilot test feasibility prenatal lifestyle intervention design limit gestational weight gain prevent gestational diabetes . The intervention base Diabetes Prevention Program lifestyle intervention , include prenatal breastfeeding education online peer group support , integrate participant ' regular prenatal appointment . Women ( n=24 ) enrol early pregnancy . After baseline assessment ( demographic , maternal diet , physical activity , mental health ) , woman randomize equally intervention usual care condition . Further data collection occur approximately 24 week gestation , 36 week gestation , 6 week postpartum , clinical data ( weight , pregnancy obstetric complication ) abstract medical record end study . Outcomes include reach dose intervention , gestational weight gain , dietary intake , physical activity , breastfeed first 6 week postpartum . The investigator hypothesize intervention reduce gestational weight gain , improve maternal dietary intake , increase total energy expenditure , increase breastfeed exclusivity first 6 week postpartum .
DOC.criteria: Singleton pregnancy < 12 week gestation Prepregnant body mass index > =30 Speak understand English Plan continue care clinic pregnancy postpartum Preexisting diabetes History serious chronic illness History prior gestational diabetes Prior delivery < 37 week gestation Prior delivery infant weigh < 2500g
